title: USED TO BE the perfect BART app for Bay Area locals
comment: This WAS the best way to quickly check realtime BART schedules, but for the last few months the schedules have been totally incorrect. Now, you're better off making random guesses at when the next train will come.  Hope this gets fixed. :(

title: Bad data?
comment: Agree with others. Seems that it used to be more accurate. Is it boo longer getting real BART data? Also, even when accurate, it seems to display arrival times not departure times which can be misleading if you're coming from an end-of-line or timed transfer station.

title: Not real time
comment: Unfortunately, the real time updates either don't work or come from a bad feed. Several times now, the app has not worked when there are delays. Standing at the rockridge Bart at the moment and it gives a spacing of 15 minutes between trains with the next in 12 on app but the station info says 1, 9, 27.
Fsst, easy, perfect.
Predictions are WRONG and made me miss an airport train!  The BART website prediction is right, what data are you using??

title: Great App
comment: Really convenient for checking my next train. I use it all the time. Nicely done, I only wish it was available on my lock screen.

title: Great,  simple Bart app
comment: Perfect for quickly checking how long until the next train. The only time I needed something that the app didn't have was when we knew we were going to be out late and wanted to know the time of the last train leaving the city.

title: Missing station
comment: No west Dublin/Pleasanton station.  Pretty massive oversight.  *Update*  Thanks for adding this on the recent update!
Whooops! Fixed this in 0.5.7. Good call

title: Nice for what it does.
comment: Clean interface,  but I'm sticking with SR until this allows me to save favorite stations.
Mmmmm
Works well, no surprises

title: Great app. Great interface
comment: I'm glad this app included a map of the system. I installed this app when visiting the bay area. The one place I wanted to go was West Dublin. It did not come up when I typed it in.  I just guessed arrival would be between Dublin/P and Castro Valley. Otherwise works great.
Whooops! Fixed West Dublin/Pleasanton not being auto-completed in 0.5.7

title: Elegant
comment: A good map, quick arrival time interface, cost clearly displayed, no lingering service to clutter up you Android task bar with another icon like other similar apps.
Open Source ftw!

title: Simple yet effective
comment: Maybe a little to simple for bart noobs like me. But i figured it out... Maybe add "mins" to the counter instead of just the number clobbering down?

title: Good, simple app
comment: No frills, as advertised if you need an app that is resource friendly, this seems to be one of the best

title: Sexyyyy
comment: Good

title: Besy
comment: Doperr

title: It's ok
comment: Works but not enough features, iBART is better

title: Does what it says
comment: No ads. No malware. Open source.  map integration would be nice and make out it a five star app.

title: Simple
comment: If you've already BART enough to know which station yo uwant to go to, this app is perfect. Simple, straightforward, and accurate.
It is both the app SF needs and the one it deserves.

title: Simple
comment: Simple,, easy to use, fast.

title: So quick and clean
comment: Probably the best way to find BART times. Coolest part is that the icon label cuts off so it looks like "Open Bar" - which is usually where I'm going anyway!
works perfectly

title: GPL sucks
comment: Would have been 5 stars, but it's GPLed.

title: Best bart app
comment: Accurate, with a great look.  And it's open source! Woo Hoo!

title: The BART app I've been looking for
comment: Quick. Even better after the update!

title: Awesome
comment: Best bart app, fast, accurate, open source, no ads, great icon! A+
